snippet.title: Been hacked? Don't dial 999: The plods are too dense, sniffs sec bigwig
snippet.description:
Been hacked? Don't dial 999: The plods are too dense, sniffs sec bigwig
Police are powerless to stop super-smart criminals from hacking the world's biggest companies, a top-ranking security bod has warned. Juniper Networks' security chief said there was simply no longer any point in calling the police when hackers and DDoSers came to call, because the cops can't do anything. He wants to see a world …
Jasper Hamill, 29 Jul 2013

snippet.title: Brits adopt 'safe surfing' habits
snippet.description:
Brits adopt 'safe surfing' habits
Nine in 10 Britons take security precautions when surfing online, according to a new survey which goes against previous research that suggested Britain was a nation of cyber-security slackers. The upbeat poll of 2,000 Brits, commissioned by the British Computer Society (BCS), also found that 92 per cent of online shoppers take …
John Leyden, 09 Aug 2006

snippet.title: Crispy vulture beats bald eagle
snippet.description:
Crispy vulture beats bald eagle
The US government has decided to hang on to control of the net's root servers. Not an entirely unanticipated move, but one that will, as they say, have repercussions. Lots of cross Americans immediately wrote to us to explain why we should be pleased that Uncle Sam is still in charge: The US created the internet. Next thing …
Lucy Sherriff, 01 Jul 2005
